member.name: ID3D12Device9.CreateCommandQueue1

summary.para: Creates a command queue with a creator ID.

member.param: Specifies a D3D12_COMMAND_QUEUE_DESC that describes the command queue.
The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the command queue interface.
A pointer to a memory block that receives a pointer to the interface for the command queue.
member.returns: Returns E_OUTOFMEMORY if there's insufficient memory to create the command queue; otherwise S_OK. See Direct3D 12 return codes for other possible return values.

member.name: ID3D12Device9.CreateShaderCacheSession
member.summary: Creates an object that grants access to a shader cache, potentially opening an existing cache or creating a new one.
member.param: A D3D12_SHADER_CACHE_SESSION_DESC structure describing the shader cache session to create.
The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the shader cache session interface.
A pointer to a memory block that receives a pointer to the interface for the shader cache session.

returns.para: If the function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULTerror code.
|Return value|Description| |-|-| | DXGI_ERROR_ALREADY_EXISTS | You tried to create a cache with an existing identifier. See . |

member.name: ID3D12Device9.ShaderCacheControl
member.summary: Modifies the behavior of caches used internally by Direct3D or by the driver. ShaderCacheControl may be used only in developer mode.
member.param: The caches to modify. Any one of these caches may or may not exist.
The way in which to modify the caches. You can't pass both DISABLE and ENABLE at the same time; and you must pass at least one flag.

member.name: ID3D12Device9
member.summary: Represents a virtual adapter. This interface extends to add methods to manage shader caches.
